Body: Possible Duplicate:  Why did /sdcard/ turn into /sdcard/0/ with 4.2?  I'm just really confused about the file structure of the sdcard on the root of the sdcard theres the regular symlink of /sdcard to the actual internal sdcard folder, but heres where it gets weirdin the /storage folder theres a symlink from /storage/sdcard0 (the normal sdcard folder) to /storage/emulated/legacy, which i guess is the folder that everything was moved to when i updated to cm10.1, but there is also a /storage/emulated/0 folder, which was the automatic backup of my sdcard when i updated to 10.1, but it stays in sync with the /storage/emulated/legacy folderalso in /data/media there are /data/media/0 and /data/media/legacy folders (not symlinks, as far as i can tell) and /mnt/shell has the same folders, /mnt/shell/legacy and /mnt/shell/0 (once again, not symlinks)any idea which folders i can delete? is there any way to return to the old file structure where the sdcard was just at /storage/sdcard0?
Title: What's up with the 4.2 file structure?

history.Text: I'm just really confused about the file structure of the sdcard on the root of the sdcard theres the regular symlink of /sdcard to the actual internal sdcard folder, but heres where it gets weirdin the /storage folder theres a symlink from /storage/sdcard0 (the normal sdcard folder) to /storage/emulated/legacy, which i guess is the folder that everything was moved to when i updated to cm10.1, but there is also a /storage/emulated/0 folder, which was the automatic backup of my sdcard when i updated to 10.1, but it stays in sync with the /storage/emulated/legacy folderalso in /data/media there are /data/media/0 and /data/media/legacy folders (not symlinks, as far as i can tell) and /mnt/shell has the same folders, /mnt/shell/legacy and /mnt/shell/0 (once again, not symlinks)any idea which folders i can delete? is there any way to return to the old file structure where the sdcard was just at /storage/sdcard0?
What's up with the 4.2 file structure?

> **Possible Duplicate:**  > [Why did /sdcard/ turn into /sdcard/0/ with 4.2?](http://android.stackexchange.com/questions/35541/why-did-sdcard-turn-into-sdcard-0-with-4-2)  I'm just really confused about the file structure of the sdcard on the root of the sdcard theres the regular symlink of /sdcard to the actual internal sdcard folder, but heres where it gets weirdin the /storage folder theres a symlink from /storage/sdcard0 (the normal sdcard folder) to /storage/emulated/legacy, which i guess is the folder that everything was moved to when i updated to cm10.1, but there is also a /storage/emulated/0 folder, which was the automatic backup of my sdcard when i updated to 10.1, but it stays in sync with the /storage/emulated/legacy folderalso in /data/media there are /data/media/0 and /data/media/legacy folders (not symlinks, as far as i can tell) and /mnt/shell has the same folders, /mnt/shell/legacy and /mnt/shell/0 (once again, not symlinks)any idea which folders i can delete? is there any way to return to the old file structure where the sdcard was just at /storage/sdcard0?
